humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: Based on the information provided in the pathology report, there are two tumors in the right breast. The first tumor (T1) has a largest dimension of 3.6 cm, and the second tumor (T2) has a largest dimension of 2.5 cm. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2, based on the size of the largest tumor (T2) which is 2.5 cm.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this report, there are two invasive tumors in the right breast, with the largest one measuring 3.6 cm in largest dimension (T2 stage, 2.1-5 cm). The left breast shows no malignancy. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
